title: failed to get layout for `[type error]`: the type `[type error]` has an unknown layout

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust fn main() { let counts = HashMap = HashMap.new() println!("{:?}",counts); } ``` ### Meta ```rustc 1.60.0-nightly (51126be1b 2022-01-24) binary: rustc commit-hash: 51126be1b260216b41143469086e6e6ee567647e commit-date: 2022-01-24 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.60.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0: ``` ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_codegen_llvm/src/context.rs:895:13: failed to get layout for `[type error]`: the type `[type error]` has an unknown layout ```
Backtrace

``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_codegen_llvm/src/context.rs:895:13: failed to get layout for `[type error]`: the type `[type error]` has an unknown layout --> src/main.rs:1:1 | 1 | fn main() { | ^^^^^^^^^ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/51126be1b260216b41143469086e6e6ee567647e/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1103:9 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic:: 1: std::panic::panic_any:: 2: ::span_bug:: 3: ::span_bug:: 4: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt::::{closure#0}, ()> 5: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt:: 6: rustc_middle::util::bug::span_bug_fmt:: 7: ::handle_layout_err 8: ::spanned_layout_of::{closure#0} 9: , rustc_codegen_ssa::mir::analyze::non_ssa_locals::{closure#0}> as core::iter::traits::iterator::Iterator>::fold::<(), core::iter::traits::iterator::Iterator::for_each::call as alloc::vec::spec_extend::SpecExtend, rustc_codegen_ssa::mir::analyze::non_ssa_locals::{closure#0}>>>::spec_extend::{closure#0}>::{closure#0}> 10: rustc_codegen_ssa::mir::analyze::non_ssa_locals:: 11: rustc_codegen_ssa::mir::codegen_mir:: 12: rustc_codegen_llvm::base::compile_codegen_unit::module_codegen 13: >::with_task::> 14: rustc_codegen_llvm::base::compile_codegen_unit 15: rustc_codegen_ssa::base::codegen_crate:: 16: ::codegen_crate 17: ::time::, rustc_interface::passes::start_codegen::{closure#0}> 18: ::ongoing_codegen 19: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> 20: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#1}> 21: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}> 22: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.60.0-nightly (51126be1b 2022-01-24) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error ```
